what_is_this: A curated registry of best-in-class tools for common development tasks. Optimized for AI agents to read and act on. Each entry includes install commands, environment variables, and ready-to-run code.
how_to_use: Find the task you need by id or keywords. Use the 'best' recommendation. Each entry has working code you can execute directly. All pricing data is verified from official sources.

tasks.task: Convert audio or video file to text

best.why: 216x real-time speed (1 hour of audio in ~17 seconds). $0.04/hr — 9x cheaper than OpenAI, 11x cheaper than Deepgram. Free tier: ~8 hrs/day of audio. Multilingual (99+ languages).

code.python:
from groq import Groq

client = Groq()

with open("audio.mp3", "rb") as f:
    result = client.audio.transcriptions.create(
        model="whisper-large-v3-turbo",
        file=f,
        response_format="verbose_json"
    )

print(result.text)

best.pricing: $0.04/hr (v3-turbo), $0.02/hr (distil-whisper, English only), $0.111/hr (v3 full). Batch API: 50% off.
best.free_tier: 28,800 audio-seconds/day (~8 hrs). No credit card required.

alternatives.why: Most widely documented. GPT-4o Mini Transcribe is a good budget option at $0.18/hr.
alternatives.free_tier: $5 credit for new accounts (expires in 3 months)

alternatives.why: Real-time streaming support. $200 in free credits (no expiry) — most generous trial. $0.0077/min pay-as-you-go.
alternatives.free_tier: $200 free credits (~433 hours), no credit card required

alternatives.why: Lowest non-Groq base rate at $0.15/hr. Add-ons for diarization, sentiment, PII redaction. $50 free credits.

tasks.warning: Do NOT use local openai/whisper pip package for production. It processes audio at roughly 1:1 real-time speed on CPU. Always use a cloud API.

tasks.task: Set up a relational database for a web application

best.why: Full Postgres database with auto-generated REST API, built-in auth (50K MAUs free), and file storage. Excellent structured documentation that agents can parse easily. Most frequently chosen by AI agents.

code.python:
from supabase import create_client
import os

supabase = create_client(os.environ['SUPABASE_URL'], os.environ['SUPABASE_ANON_KEY'])

# Insert
supabase.table('users').insert({'name': 'Alice', 'email': 'alice@example.com'}).execute()

# Query
result = supabase.table('users').select('*').eq('name', 'Alice').execute()
print(result.data)

best.pricing: Free: 500MB database, 1GB storage, 5GB bandwidth, 50K auth MAUs, 2 projects (pauses after 7 days idle). Pro: $25/mo (8GB DB, 100GB storage, 250GB bandwidth). Overage: $0.125/GB storage, $0.09/GB bandwidth.
best.free_tier: 500MB database, 2 active projects. Projects pause after 1 week of inactivity.

alternatives.why: Serverless Postgres that scales to zero. Free: 0.5GB/project, 100 compute-hours/mo, 100 projects. Storage dropped to $0.35/GB-month in 2025. Great for side projects.
SQLite-based (libSQL), edge-first. Most generous free tier: 5GB storage, 500M row reads/mo, 100 databases. $4.99/mo developer plan.

tasks.task: Store and serve files (images, documents, videos) from your application

best.why: S3-compatible API (use any existing S3 SDK). Zero egress fees — you never pay for downloads. Global CDN included. ~$15/mo for 1TB vs hundreds on S3.

setup.get_api_key: https://dash.cloudflare.com → R2 → Manage R2 API Tokens

code.python:
import boto3
import os

s3 = boto3.client('s3',
    endpoint_url=f'https://{os.environ["R2_ACCOUNT_ID"]}.r2.cloudflarestorage.com',
    aws_access_key_id=os.environ['R2_ACCESS_KEY_ID'],
    aws_secret_access_key=os.environ['R2_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY']
)

# Upload
s3.upload_file('local_file.png', 'my-bucket', 'uploads/file.png')

# Generate download URL
url = s3.generate_presigned_url('get_object',
    Params={'Bucket': 'my-bucket', 'Key': 'uploads/file.png'},
    ExpiresIn=3600
)
print(url)

best.pricing: Storage: $0.015/GB-month. Class A ops (writes): $4.50/million. Class B ops (reads): $0.36/million. Egress: $0 (always free).
best.free_tier: 10GB storage, 1M Class A ops/mo, 10M Class B ops/mo. Zero egress fees.

alternatives.why: Good if already using Supabase. 1GB free. Integrated auth and row-level security policies.
Industry standard, broadest ecosystem. But has egress fees ($0.09/GB).

tasks.task: Accept payments, subscriptions, or one-time purchases in your application

best.why: Gold-standard API docs — extremely well-structured, interactive examples. Most flexible: one-time, recurring, usage-based, metered billing. Largest ecosystem of integrations.

best.pricing: 2.9% + $0.30 per transaction (US cards). No monthly fees. International cards: +1.5%. Stripe Tax, Billing, Radar are additional.

alternatives.why: Merchant of Record — handles global tax compliance, chargebacks, invoicing. 5% + $0.50 per transaction. No extra international fees. Best for SaaS wanting zero tax work.
Also MoR (owned by Stripe since July 2024). 5% + $0.50 per transaction. Simplest setup for indie hackers. Reports of support degradation since acquisition.

tasks.task: Store and search vector embeddings for AI/RAG applications

best.why: Open source (Apache 2.0), written in Rust. Best price/performance ratio. 60-80% cheaper than Pinecone at scale. 1GB free cloud tier (permanent). Can self-host for free.

code.python:
from qdrant_client import QdrantClient
from qdrant_client.models import Distance, VectorParams, PointStruct

client = QdrantClient(url="https://xxx.cloud.qdrant.io", api_key="your-key")

# Create collection
client.create_collection(
    collection_name="my_docs",
    vectors_config=VectorParams(size=1536, distance=Distance.COSINE)
)

# Insert vectors
client.upsert(collection_name="my_docs", points=[
    PointStruct(id=1, vector=[0.1]*1536, payload={"text": "Hello world"}),
    PointStruct(id=2, vector=[0.2]*1536, payload={"text": "Goodbye world"}),
])

# Search
results = client.query_points(
    collection_name="my_docs",
    query=[0.1]*1536,
    limit=5
)
print(results)

best.pricing: Self-hosted: free. Cloud: 1GB free (permanent). Paid: usage-based, ~$102/mo for standard AWS config.
best.free_tier: 1GB free cloud tier (no expiry). Self-hosting is completely free.

alternatives.why: Easiest managed setup. Free: 2GB storage, 2M writes/mo, 1M reads/mo. But $50/mo minimum on paid plans (price increased Sept 2025). No self-hosting option.
Easiest to start with — in-memory mode, zero config. Open source (Apache 2.0). Best for prototyping. Migrate away above ~10M vectors.

tasks.task: Add caching or a key-value store to your application

best.why: Only connectionless (HTTP-based) Redis — works everywhere: Lambda, Workers, Edge, WASM. No persistent connections needed. Best free tier among managed Redis options.

setup.get_api_key: https://console.upstash.com → Create database → REST API credentials

import os

redis = Redis(
    url=os.environ['UPSTASH_REDIS_REST_URL'],
    token=os.environ['UPSTASH_REDIS_REST_TOKEN']
)

redis.set('user:1', 'Alice')
print(redis.get('user:1'))

best.pricing: Free: 256MB storage, 500K commands/mo, 10 databases. Pay-as-you-go: from $10/mo. Bandwidth: 200GB free, then $0.03/GB.
best.free_tier: 256MB storage, 500K commands/month, up to 10 databases. Permanent.

alternatives.why: Full Redis feature set (modules, RediSearch, RedisJSON). Requires persistent connections (not ideal for serverless). No permanent free tier — 14-day trial with $500 credit.
Powered by Upstash under the hood. Only useful if already on Vercel. 30K requests/mo on free plan (Hobby, non-commercial only). Use Upstash directly for better pricing.

tasks.task: Add full-text search to your application

best.why: Open source (MIT), written in Rust. Has an official MCP server for AI agent integration. 8.9x cheaper than Algolia. Best typo tolerance out of the box. Easy self-hosting.

code.python:
import meilisearch

client = meilisearch.Client('http://localhost:7700', 'masterKey')

client.index('movies').add_documents([
    {'id': 1, 'title': 'Inception', 'genre': 'Sci-Fi'},
    {'id': 2, 'title': 'Interstellar', 'genre': 'Sci-Fi'},
])

results = client.index('movies').search('incption')
print(results['hits'])

best.pricing: Self-hosted: free (MIT). Cloud: from ~$30/mo (~$59/mo for 250K records + 1M searches).
best.free_tier: Self-hosted: completely free. Cloud: contact for trial.

alternatives.why: Best-documented search API. Free (Build): 10K searches/mo, 1M records. Grow: $0.50/1K requests. Most expensive at scale but most features. Startup program: $10K credits.
Open source (GPL v3), written in C++. Cheapest cloud: from ~$7/mo. In-memory architecture = fast queries. GPL license is more restrictive than Meilisearch's MIT.

tasks.task: Send SMS or text messages from your application

best.why: Best documentation in the industry — highly structured API reference, code samples in 7+ languages. Most predictable pricing. Widest ecosystem of integrations.

setup.get_api_key: https://console.twilio.com → Account SID and Auth Token on dashboard

code.python:
from twilio.rest import Client
import os

client = Client(os.environ['TWILIO_ACCOUNT_SID'], os.environ['TWILIO_AUTH_TOKEN'])

message = client.messages.create(
    body='Hello from agent-need!',
    from_=os.environ['TWILIO_PHONE_NUMBER'],
    to='+1234567890'
)

print(message.sid)

best.pricing: US SMS: ~$0.0079/msg outbound + carrier fees (~$0.0083 total). Phone number: $1.15/mo (local). MMS: $0.022/msg.
best.free_tier: $15.50 trial credit. Limited to verified numbers. Messages prefixed with 'Sent from a Twilio Trial account'.

alternatives.why: Similar pricing (~$0.008/SMS). Messages API supports SMS + WhatsApp + Facebook Messenger in one API. EUR 2 trial credit.

best.free_tier: 50K executions/month. 256KB payload. Sleep up to 7 days.

tasks.task: Upload, transform, optimize, and serve images in your application

best.why: Best-in-class documentation with interactive code samples in 10+ languages. URL-based transformations (resize, crop, format conversion via URL parameters). Global CDN included.

code.python:
import cloudinary
import cloudinary.uploader

# Auto-configured from CLOUDINARY_URL env var

result = cloudinary.uploader.upload('local_image.jpg', folder='my-app')
print(result['secure_url'])

# Transform via URL
url = cloudinary.utils.cloudinary_url(result['public_id'],
    width=300, height=300, crop='fill',
    fetch_format='auto', quality='auto'
)[0]
print(url)

best.pricing: Free: 25 credits/mo (1 credit = 1GB storage OR 1GB bandwidth OR 1K transformations). Plus: $89/mo (225 credits). Advanced: $224/mo (600 credits).
best.free_tier: 25 credits/month. No time limit, no credit card required.

alternatives.why: Focused on file uploading UX. Free: 1K operations/mo, 5GB traffic, 1GB storage. SOC2 and HIPAA compliant. Up to 5TB per file on paid plans.
Pure image CDN/optimization via URL parameters. Simple but no permanent free tier (30-day trial only). From ~$62.50/mo.

tasks.task: Track errors, exceptions, and application performance

best.why: Industry standard for error tracking. Extremely comprehensive framework-specific docs with onboarding wizards. Supports every major language and framework.

code.python:
import sentry_sdk
import os

sentry_sdk.init(dsn=os.environ['SENTRY_DSN'])

# Errors are automatically captured
# Manual capture:
try:
    risky_operation()
except Exception as e:
    sentry_sdk.capture_exception(e)

best.pricing: Free (Developer): 5K errors/mo, 10K performance units/mo, 1 user. Team: $26/mo (50K errors). Business: $80/mo (100K errors).
best.free_tier: 5,000 errors/month, 10,000 performance units/month, 1 user. Forever free.

alternatives.why: Most generous free tier for logs: 500GB/mo data ingestion. From $25/mo paid. Best for log aggregation and serverless observability.
Combines uptime monitoring + logging + incident management. Free: 10 monitors, 1GB logs, 3-day retention. Team: $24/mo.
